Name: RTX 4080
Performance: Outstanding for 4K gaming with ray tracing and DLSS 3. Excellent productivity performance in Blender, Adobe, and AI workloads (Ada Lovelace).

Name: RTX 4060
Performance: RTX 4060 – Great for 1080p gaming, decent 1440p. Entry-level productivity; limited VRAM and memory bandwidth can bottleneck heavier tasks.

Name: RTX 4070
Performance: Great for 1080p gaming, decent 1440p. Entry-level productivity; limited VRAM and memory bandwidth can bottleneck heavier tasks.

Name: RTX 3050
Performance: Good 1080p gaming. Entry-level productivity; usable for light rendering and editing with CUDA acceleration.

Name: RTX 2080
Performance: Very capable 1440p/entry 4K gaming. Strong productivity performance for its generation with ray tracing and CUDA support.

Name: GTX 1660
Performance: Good 1080p gaming. Basic productivity support; lacks tensor/RT cores and NVENC advancements for serious workloads.

Name: GTX 1080
Performance: Still solid for 1080p/1440p gaming. OK for older rendering pipelines but lacks ray tracing, tensor cores, and modern acceleration.

Name: GTX 1060
Performance: Casual 1080p gaming. Light productivity use only; outdated for modern 3D workflows.

Name: GT 970
Performance: Outdated; playable 900p/1080p in older titles. Poor productivity performance by today’s standards.

Name: RADEON RX 6400
Performance: Very entry-level 1080p gaming. Poor for 3D/design work; limited hardware acceleration and memory bandwidth.

Name: RADEON RX 6500 XT
Performance: Playable 1080p with compromises. Weak productivity; missing hardware encoders and only PCIe x4 support hurts.

Name: RADEON RX 6600
Performance: Solid 1080p gaming. Decent for light editing, but lacks CUDA/NVENC alternatives, limiting efficiency in many tools.

Name: RADEON RX 6600XT
Performance: Great for 1080p, capable 1440p gaming. Good for light-medium 3D and design tasks.

Name: RADEON RX 6650 XT
Performance: Improved 6600 XT with faster clocks. Slight edge in gaming and design work, but still limited for pro workloads.

Name: RADEON RX 6700 XT
Performance: Very good 1440p gaming. Strong in productivity where GPU OpenCL/Vulkan are used, but weaker in CUDA-dominant apps.

Name: RADEON RX 6750 XT
Performance: Faster version of 6700 XT; great for 1440p and light 4K. Suitable for semi-professional workloads.

Name: RADEON RX 6800
Performance: Excellent 1440p and strong 4K gaming. Very competent for rendering, though not ideal for CUDA-based pipelines.

Name: RADEON RX 6950
Performance: Top-tier RDNA2 gaming card. Great for 3D rendering, editing, and design—especially in OpenCL/Vulkan apps.

Name: RADEON RX 7900
Performance: Powerful for 4K gaming. Competitive in professional work (rendering, editing) with modern AV1 encoding and high VRAM (20–24 GB).
